Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor drew a crucial walk against Devin Williams, which sparked the Mets' comeback.
Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead, three-run homer off Devin Williams.
Starling Marte added an insurance RBI single.
Brice Turang hit a one-hopper at Francisco Lindor, who completed a double play to end the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Cohen expressed hope after Francisco Lindor's walk.
Brandon Nimmo praised Francisco Lindor's professional at-bat.
David Stearns highlighted Lindor's consistent performance throughout the season.
Brandon Nimmo emphasized Lindor's leadership and impact on the team.
Steve Cohen reflected on Lindor's foundational role in the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets won their first playoff series since taking the 2015 pennant.
The Mets overcame a history of struggles in Milwaukee by winning two of three games.
Francisco Lindor had arguably the finest positional year in franchise history.
Jose Quintana held the Brewers hitless in 11 at-bats with men on base.
